sen.j: 陰徳太平記（いんとくたいへいき）は日本文学の1つである。
sen.e: Intoku Taiheiki is a Japanese literary work.
Intoku Taiheiki is a Japanese literary work.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Intoku taiheiki is a work of Japanese literature.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 全81巻と「陰徳記序および目録」1冊で、戦国時代 (日本)の山陰地方、山陽地方を中心に、室町時代13代将軍足利義輝の時代から、慶長の役まで（永正8年（1507年）頃-慶長3年（1598年）頃までの約90年間）を書く軍記物語。
sen.e: It is a war chronicle consisting of eighty-one volumes in total and a volume "Intokuki jo oyobi mokuroku" (preface for the intokuki and list of contents) which describes centering on Sanin region and Sanyo region from the era of the thirteenth shogun, Ｙｏｓｈｉｔｅｒｕ ASHIKAGA to the Keicho Campaign (around 1507 - around 1598).

It is a war chronicle consisting of 81 volumes plus a volume "Intokuki jo oyobi mokuroku," (preface for the intokuki and list of contents) whose description centers on the Sanin region and Sanyo region from the era of the thirteenth shogun, Ｙｏｓｈｉｔｅｒｕ ASHIKAGA, to the Keicho Campaign (from around 1507 to around 1598).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is a war chronicle comprising 81 volumes plus a separate volume entitled "Intokuki jo oyobi mokuroku" (Preface and Table of Contents for the Intokuki); it is focused mainly on the Sanin and Sanyo regions and begins its account in the time of the thirteenth Shogun of the Muromachi period, Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, and continuing until the Keicho Campaign (or in other words, it covers a roughly 90-year span from 1507 to 1598).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現存するのは山口県文書館蔵本と毛利家蔵本である。
sen.e: Existing copies are one possessed by Yamaguchiken Bunshokan and another possessed by the Mori family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外措置
sen.e: Existing copies are one held by Yamaguchiken Bunshokan and another held by the Mori family.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: There are only two extant copies, one owned by the Yamaguchiken Bunshokan (Yamaguchi Prefectural Archives) and the other by the Mori family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 前者は昭和初期に焼失した香川家旧蔵本の写し、後者は毛利宗家へ献上されたものとみられる。
sen.e: The former was a manuscript of the book once possessed by the Kagawa family, which was burnt at the beginning of Showa era and the latter seems to have been donated to the head family of the Mori family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外措置
sen.e: The former was a manuscript of the book once possessed by the Kagawa family, which was burned at the beginning of the Showa era, and the latter seems to have been donated to the head family of the Mori family.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The former was a copy of the manuscript that was owned by the Kagawa family before it was lost in an early Showa-era fire, while the latter seems to have been donated to the main branch of the Mori family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 他に吉川家旧蔵本が存在したが、震災で焼失したという。
sen.e: It is told that there was the book once possessed by the Kikkawa family, but it was burnt in the earthquake disaster.
It is said that there was the book once possessed by the Kikkawa family, but it was burned in an earthquake disaster.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In addition, it is said that the Kikkawa family used to own a manuscript copy but that it was lost in an earthquake-related fire.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 岩国領の家老香川正矩によって編纂され、その二男香川宣阿（宣阿）が補足した。
sen.e: It was compiled by Masanori KAGAWA, who was a karo (senior retainer) of the Iwakuni domain, and his second son, Sena KAGAWA (Sena) supplemented it.
It was compiled by Masanori KAGAWA, who was a karo (senior retainer) of the Iwakuni domain, and his second son, Sena KAGAWA (Sena) supplemented it.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It was compiled by Masanori KAGAWA, a karo (senior retainer) of the Iwakuni domain, whose second son, Sena KAGAWA (also known simply as "Sena") made a supplement for it.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 香川正矩はその原典というべき『陰徳記』を書くも、万治3年（1660年）執筆半ばにして逝去した。
sen.e: Although Masanori KAGAWA wrote "Intokuki", which we can deem as the source book, he died in 1660 halfway of writing.
Although Masanori KAGAWA wrote "Intokuki," which we can deemed the source book, he died in 1660 halfway through the writing process.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Although Masanori KAGAWA began writing the "Intokuki," judged to be the source on which Intoku taiheiki is based, he died in 1660, before making it more than halfway through the writing.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 父の遺志を継いだ香川景継は京都に遊学、執筆を続ける。
sen.e: Kagetsugu KAGAWA, who succeeded his father's last wish, visited Kyoto to study and continued writing.
Kagetsugu KAGAWA, who succeeded to his father's last wish, visited Kyoto to study and continued writing.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Kagetsugu KAGAWA, who promised to fulfill his father's dying wish, went to Kyoto to study, and continued the writing of it.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 寛文5年（1665年）兄香川正恒は、岩国出身の儒学者宇都宮三近に「陰徳記序」を書いてもらう。
sen.e: In 1665, his elder brother, Masatsune KAGAWA made to have "Intokuki jo" written by Sankin UTSUNOMIYA, who was a Confusian scholar from Iwakuni.
In 1665, his elder brother Masatsune KAGAWA had "Intokuki jo" written by Sankin UTSUNOMIYA, who was a Confucian scholar from Iwakuni.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In 1665, his elder brother Masatsune KAGAWA had Sankin UTSUNOMIYA, a Confucian scholar from Iwakuni, write the preface to the Intokuki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 元禄8年（1695年）景継は「陰徳記自序」を書いており、この頃には完成していたと考えられている。
sen.e: In 1695, Kagetsugu wrote "Intokuki jijo"(preface by the author) and it is considered that he completed it by this time.
In 1695, Kagetsugu wrote "Intokuki jijo" (preface by the author), and it is considered that he had completed it by this time.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: In 1695, Kagetsugu wrote the "Intokuki jijo" (Authorial Preface to the Intokuki), and it is thought that it was around this date that he completed work on the Intokuki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 元禄11年（1698年）岩国領の検閲を経て、宝永3年（1706年）出版許可、享保2年（1717年）出版に至った。
sen.e: After review by the local government of Iwakuni in 1698, approval for publication was given in 1706 and it was published in 1717.
Subsequent to a review by the local government of Iwakuni in 1698, approval for publication was given in 1706 and it was published in 1717.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: After being reviewed by the local government of Iwakuni in 1698, it was approved for publication in 1706 and was actually published in 1717.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 出版にかかる費用の大半を藩に負担させるため、藩主吉川氏と宗家毛利氏、そしてその始祖である毛利元就にとって都合の良いように改稿されている。
sen.e: In order to have a larger part of expenses for publication born by the clan, it was revised favorably to the Kikkawa family and the chief family, namely the Mori family, and the founder, Motonari MORI>

In order to have a larger part of the expenses for publication borne by the clan, it was revised to show, in a favorable light, Kikkawa family and the chief family, namely the Mori family, particularly the founder, Motonari MORI.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: In order to get the domain to pay a larger share of the publishing expenses, the Intokuki was revised to paint the both the Kikkawa family and the main branch of the Mori family--and particular the family founder, Motonari MORI--in a more favorable light.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 完成から出版までに22年もかかったのは、内容を改編する必要性と当時の吉川家中、上方情勢を見極めていたためと考えられている。
sen.e: The reasons why it took twenty-two years are considered that certain time was needed to revise contents and to judge on then current situations in the Kikkawa family and situation in Kamigata (area surrounding Kyoko and Osaka).

It is thought to have taken 22 years because a certain amount of time was needed to revise the contents and judge on the then-current situations in the Kikkawa family and Kamigata (the area surrounding Kyoko and Osaka).
sen.cmt: number
sen.e: 22 years passed between when it was finished and when it was published; this is thought to be due to the fact that a certain amount of time was necessary to revise the contents in light of the then-current circumstances of the Kikkawa family and the situation in the Kamigata region (the area surrounding Kyoto and Osaka).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 吉川元春夫人が絶世の醜女という説についても、吉川広家が存命中に成立した可能性がある『安西軍策』には元春夫人（熊谷氏）の器量が悪かったとの記述はない。
sen.e: With respect to the view that the wife of Motoharu KIKKAWA was a very ugly woman, there is no description in "Ansei Gunsaku [安西軍策 正しい読み不明]", which could be formed while Hiroie KIKKAWA was still alive, that Motoharu's wife (Kumagai family) was unattractive.

Regarding the view that the wife of Motoharu KIKKAWA was a very ugly woman, there is no description in "Ansei Gunsaku [安西軍策 正しい読み不明]," which could have been produced while Hiroie KIKKAWA was still alive, that Motoharu's wife (Kumagai family) was unattractive.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Furthermore, regarding the claim that Motoharu KIKKAWA's wife was extremely ugly, no such description of Motoharu's wife (who was of the Kumagai clan) exists in the "Anzai gunsaku," which may have been produced while Hiroie KIKKAWA was still alive.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし香川正矩の『陰徳記』に「器量が悪い」との記述が現われ、香川宣阿の『陰徳太平記』に継承されている。
sen.e: In "Intokuki" by Masanori KAGAWA, however, there is a description of "unattractive" and it is inherited in "Intoku Taiheiki" by Sena KAGAWA.
However, in "Intokuki," by Masanori KAGAWA, there is a description of "unattractive"; this assessment is inherited in "Intoku Taiheiki," by Sena KAGAWA.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: But in the Masanori KAGAWA's "Intokuki," she is described as "unattractive," and this assessment was passed down to Sena KAGAWA's "Intoku taiheiki."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 史料的価値
sen.e: Value as historical material
Value as historical material
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Value as historical material
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 脚色のみならず誤記も多い。
sen.e: There are not only adaptation, but also many errors in writing.
The writing contains not only various adaptations but also many errors.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: Not only is it full of dramatizations of events, it also contains many factual errors.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 『甲陽軍鑑』や『雲陽軍実記』同様、この頃の歴史軍記自体が我が先祖の栄光や武勇を誇るための手段の一つであり、そのため多くの脚色があり、誤記と思われる箇所も多い。
sen.e: Same as "Koyo Gunkan" and "Unyogun Jikki," historical chronicles at that time themselves were one of means to boast glory and bravery of the ancestor and, therefore, they often contain adaptation and many portions that seems to be error in writing.

As is the case with "Koyo Gunkan" and "Unyogun Jikki," historical chronicles of the time were one of means to boast the glory and bravery of the ancestor; thus they often contain adaptations and many portions that seem to be errors in writing.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: Much as was the case with "Koyo gunkan" and "Unyogun jikki," in that period writing historical chronicles was one of the methods by which a person could praise the glory and bravery of his or her own ancestors, and hence they contain many overly dramatized sections as well as portions thought to be factual errors.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このような理由により、一次史料ほどの信頼性が無く、一般的には低い評価がなされる。
sen.e: Because of such reasons, they are not so reliable as primary historical materials and, usually, evaluated low.
Consequently, they aren't very reliable as primary historical materials and are usually given low evaluations.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Consequently, such chronicles are entirely unreliable as primary sources, and are thought poorly of in general.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかしかながら歴史研究の結果、近年では裏付けの取れる部分も多く、「事実でないにしても、それに近いことがあった」と再評価されている。
sen.e: As the result of historical study, however, there are many parts which were proved recently and, therefore, it is reevaluated as "even if it is not true, there occurred similar thins."

As the result of historical study, however, many parts have been proved recently, and therefore it has been re-evaluated with statements such as, "Even if it isn't true, similar events have occurred."
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: On the other hand, the results of recent historical studies have actually provided corroboration for many portions of the chronicle, leading some to say "Even if it doesn't describe reality as such, something like what is described did occur," and judge the chronicle more favorably.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
